content: super easy amigurumi axolotl aren t axolotls the cutest *** please do not copy reproduce or distribute this pattern if you would like to share it please link to the pattern instead items made using this pattern are intended for personal use/gift giving only you may not sell the finished item they are decorative items not toys and are not intended for young children safety eyes are a choking hazard if you wish to showcase finished items via social media/the internet including but not limited too blogs youtube videos facebook twitter ravelry etc i ask that you please credit me as the designer and link back to my store thank you copyright emma gallimore-martin 2023 you will need 3mm crochet hook light pink yarn for the body dark pink yarn for the gills safety eyes of your choice i used 8mm eyes you can also use scraps of felt glued/sewn into place or fabric paint stuffing darning needle stitch marker to mark the beginning of your rounds needle and black thread to embroider the mouth you can also use fabric paint or felt for this *** key magic_ring magic_ring half_double_crochet half_double_crochet half treble crochets for folks who work in uk terms 2hdctog half_double_crochet two stitches together in order to decrease * indicates a repeat fo fasten_off axolotl body working with light pink yarn magic_ring 8 half_double_crochet r1 2hdc 1hdc* 12 r2 2hdc 1hdc 1hdc* 16 r3 2hdc 1hdc 1hdc 1hdc* 20 r4 2hdc 1hdc 1hdc 1hdc 1hdc* 24 r5 2hdc 1hdc 1hdc 1hdc 1hdc 1hdc* 28 r6-9 half_double_crochet all the way around 28 r10 2hdctog 1hdc 1hdc 1hdc 1hdc 1hdc* 24 r11 2hdctog 1hdc 1hdc 1hdc 1hdc* 20 r12 2hdctog 1hdc 1hdc 1hdc* 16 fo and leave a long tail for sewing put on one side while you work on your gills gills working with the darker pink yarn make 2 chain 6 starting in second chain from hook half_double_crochet in each stitch 5hdc chain 6 skip first chain stitch half_double_crochet in each stitch 5hdc ch6 skip first chain stitch half_double_crochet in each stitch 5hdc fo leaving a long tail for sewing this step sounds a lot more complicated than it is i have included photos to illustrate assembly flatten axolotl body so that your stitch marker is on one side see photo this will make it easier to sew across the bottom of the body to close sew the gills to each side of the body fastening off inside attach the eyes i placed mine in line with the middle gill roughly 3 or 4 stitches apart using the needle and black thread i embroidered the mouth between the eyes stuff well but be careful not to over stuff as this may stretch out your stitches once you are happy with your axolotl you can sew the bottom shut and weave the end through the body and that s it you re done
